org.jerkar.api.file

Class JkPath

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.api.file.JkPath
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File>

    public final class JkPath
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File>
    A sequence of file (folder or archive) to be used as a path.
    Each file is called an entry.
    Instances of this class are immutable.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JkPath and(java.io.File... files) 
      JkPath and(java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File> otherFiles)
      Returns a JkPath made of, in the order, the entries of this one plus the specified ones.
      JkPath andHead(java.io.File... entries) 
      JkPath andHead(java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File> otherEntries)
      Returns a JkPath made of, in the order, the specified entries plus the entries of this one.
      JkPath assertAllEntriesExist()
      Throws an IllegalStateException if at least one entry does not exist.
      java.util.List<java.io.File> entries()
      Returns the sequence of files as a list.
      java.io.File first()
      Returns the first entry of this path.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Short hand for entries().isEmpty().
      java.util.Iterator<java.io.File> iterator() 
      static JkPath of(java.io.File... entries)
      Creates a path to aa array of files.
      static JkPath of(java.io.File baseDir, java.lang.String relativePathAsString)
      Creates a JkPath to a base directory and string of relative paths separated with a ";".
      static JkPath of(java.lang.Iterable<java.io.File> entries)
      Creates a path to a sequence of files.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the file names concatenated with ';'.
      JkPath withoutDuplicates()
      Returns a JkPath identical to this one but without redundant files.

      • withoutDuplicates

        public JkPath withoutDuplicates()
        Returns a JkPath identical to this one but without redundant files. So if a given file in the sequence exist twice or more, then only the first occurrence is kept.

      • entries

        public java.util.List<java.io.File> entries()
